reviews.text:
Font De La Caputxeta Vermella is a public water fountain dispensing potable water. The fountain reminds me of a gravestone with rounded top and shoulders, which immediately make the fountain a little unappealing. Atop the fountain is a statue inspired by the fairytale of The Little Red Riding Hood.

Overall, it’s okay. If you happen to be on Avinguda Diagonal and close to Sagrada Familia, then it’s only worth a detour if you have time, but I wouldn’t go out of the way. I do have a penchant for childhood nostalgia, so I took a 2 minute detour to see it.
If you have to walk around it's ok to see, but don't make an special time to do it. Passeig Sant Joan is much better below the Diagonal Av.
